intro: Mesosphaerum adpressum, commonly known as the narrowleaf mesosphaerum, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
